emissions.closest_match_explanation: Coconut milk is a direct match for '1.75 cups coconut milk'. This is the most accurate match as it directly corresponds to the ingredient without any processing changes or broader categorizations.

Green curry paste is a direct match for '3.5 tbsp green curry paste'. This is the most accurate match as it directly corresponds to the ingredient without any processing changes or broader categorizations.

Chicken stock is a liquid, ready-to-use product, making 'bouillon, chicken, prepared' the most appropriate match. This aligns with the common sense rule as 'prepared' indicates a ready-to-use liquid form, unlike 'minced chicken' or 'average chicken' which are solid forms of chicken.

For '1 lb chicken thigh', 'chicken, leg, flesh and skin, raw' is the best match. This option represents a raw, unprocessed cut of chicken, which is more specific and less processed than 'average chicken' or 'chicken, whole'. It also aligns with the common sense rule as chicken thigh is a specific part of the chicken leg.
emissions.closest_match_name: chicken, leg, flesh and skin, raw

emissions.closest_match_explanation: Palm sugar is a type of sugar. 'Sugar, sucrose, white' is a more general category of sugar and has a higher emission factor than 'sugar, brown', making it the best match according to the rule of choosing the highest emission factor when multiple viable options have similar processing levels.

Fish sauce is a fermented condiment. While 'soya sauce' and 'chili sauce' are also condiments, 'fish balls, canned' is not a suitable match as it is a solid food product. Between 'soya sauce' and 'chili sauce', 'chili sauce' has a higher emission factor and is a more processed condiment, making it the best match.

Thai basil leaves are fresh leaves. 'Basil, fresh' is the most appropriate match as it directly corresponds to the ingredient's form (fresh) and is less processed than 'basil, dried' or 'green curry paste'.
